cab.content: THIS DOCUMENT IS THE P BO PERT Y 0? HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENT) .SECRET. Copy Mo,C.P.-774. CABINET.COMMITTEE CN THE DE-CONTROL Off FOOD,MEW ZEALAND MEAT,Extract from Draft Minutes of the Fourth Meeting of the above Committee ,Jield inJTBe BoafTTobmPTreasury, on IhHHZi ^ru^'T"^%7 l"9"20V'"a f"T2 Noon.x x x x x x x x4. The Committee had under consideration s memorandumby the President of the Board of Trade, C.Pi670, in whichauthority was asicad for refusing the request of the MewZealand Government for the extension of the present con-tract to purchase Mew Zealand meat for 6 months (or at least3 months). The contract expires normally on June 30th 1920.A similar contract exists with the Australian Governmentwhich terminates 3 months after the legal termination of thewar, and might therefore be prolonged until after June 30thowing to delay in concluding peace with Turkey, in which case it was proposed to agree to a corresponding prolongation of the New Zealand contract.(1) The Committee agreed to recommend to the Cabinet -that the President of the Board of Trade should be authorised to refuse the request of the New Zealand Government for the extension of their contract:( ) The Committee strongly deprecated the purchase of more meat from the New Zealand Government, and were of opinion that it was unnecessary to oonsider the claim for the extension of the Mew Zealand contract on the ground that the Australian contract might not terminate by June 30th until that occasion arose. *S /Whitehall Gardens, S.W.I. 3rd March, 1920.
